The plant is often found growing in shaded, humid environments, thriving in the understory of dense tropical forests. Its leaves are broad and ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Anemopaegma paraense plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat, supporting various pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of the region.
